title: Create App Configuration
description: Set up the app configuration with environment-specific server URLs.
instructions:
Create an AppConfig class that:

1. Has a static serverUrl property that returns the correct URL based on environment
2. Uses String.fromEnvironment to read ENVIRONMENT variable
3. Returns 'http://localhost:8080/' for development
4. Returns 'https://api.socialchat.app/' for production
5. Includes a static isProduction getter
6. Has a static appVersion property set to '1.0.0'

hints.text: Use const String.fromEnvironment('KEY', defaultValue: 'default') to read compile-time environment variables
Use a switch statement or ternary operator to return different URLs based on environment
For WebSocket URLs, replace 'http' with 'ws' (or 'https' with 'wss') in the server URL

commonMistakes.consequence: Platform.environment reads runtime env vars, but Flutter uses compile-time dart-define
commonMistakes.correction: Use String.fromEnvironment for Flutter apps, passed via --dart-define=ENVIRONMENT=production

commonMistakes.mistake: Hardcoding server URLs without environment switching
commonMistakes.consequence: Can accidentally connect dev app to production or vice versa
